dict.string: Join Bubble Frog on his adventure!

Join Bubble Frog on his adventure to save all the Onigiri that poor little OniGary has lost! Travel dangerous places, from Pink Zone to Blue Zone and then all the way to Yellow Zone and now the terrifying GREEN ZONE!
Chumbles Bumbles his way through 6 short levels!

Welcome to my dumb little Gameboy game! You play Chumbles as he Bumbles (get it?) his way through 6 short levels. It's not a long game although there are 18 Gems to find! 3 in each level, some hidden, some not. See if you can find them all! :D (I'll warn you, one is mean).
Please feel free to let me know what you think of the game in the comments, this is my second ever finished project (although I may return to this one to make a longer game in the future) and first GB Studio game so I'm curious to hear what people think! :)
Thanks to Yogi (Tronimal) and TipTopTomCat for SFX and Music!
A unique digging game for the Atari 2600 (VCS) home console.

Using a minigun, dig holes to collect buried treasures (coins, diamonds, rubies, etc.). But be careful to never touch the ground, or you'll explode! Thankfully, each time you fire your minigun, the recoil will send you flying in the air. How to Play - Hold Fire to shoot to fly up and dig holes. Move the joystick while holding the fire button to aim in any direction. - Move joystick Left and Right while Fire button is released to move left and right. - There are items to collect (earn points), and enemies to avoid (loose game). About This game was created for the Retro Platform Jam #6 in about 3 weeks. It uses a 8K cart with SuperChip RAM to display a 32x32 destructible playfield. Programmed with the wonderful batari Basic and its in-depth documentation by Random Terrain.
Meteors are falling from the sky! Avoid them as long as possible to make an high score!

This game is my entry for the GBA Jam 2021: https://itch.io/jam/gbajam21 This is a port/remake of a previous homebrew game I did for the SEGA Mega Drive / Genesis. But for the GBA Jam, I programmed this version from scratch as it's 100% made in Lua! Indeed, I used the wonderful BPCore-Engine by Evan Bowman that allows to create a GBA games in Lua. If you ever used a fantasy console like PICO-8 or TIC-80, it's a very similar tool, but the resulting game will run on a actual console, our beloved Game Boy Advance! If you want to try your hand at making GBA games, I really recommend you BPCore-Engine: it's a real pleasure to make games with it. And I'm also sharing the heavily commented code source of my game if it can help you making your own GBA games in Lua: https://github.com/drludos/meteorain-gba Music credits Ingame music: "Overmode" by Warlord, used under a CC-BY-NC-SA licence: http://battleofthebits.org/arena/Entry/Overmode/7738/
